answers.answer: I saw something like this on one of those rare-disease shows on TV, and the child who had it got on the right track to diagnosis when the doctor asked if he had ever been tested for diabetes.  The diabetes test was clear, but it led to further testing that identified the disorder.  Sorry, can't remember the name of the illness, but at least that might be a way to start testing if you think your child has it.
I can't find an F word to help you,  but it sounds like Polyuric prerenal failure?Best wishes in your search for answers.

title: it started with a f
